DeregistrationReasonOtherText: SuperValu Logistics will no longer operate the site as of 9/17/2011

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
KTR Phoenix LLC

Phoenix

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY OF
THE EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN 



KTR Phoenix LLC Management has implemented the requirements of the Risk Management Plan in order to operate this facility in accordance with regulations and support of best industry standards.  The ultimate objective is to minimize the risk of an accidental ammonia release.  The facility management has developed an Emergency Action Plan along with training to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous material release, fire or other emergency situation.

In order to prevent a potential accidental ammonia release at the facility, the Company has an ongoing review process for design and operating procedures.  This assists in ensuring the refrigeration systems comply with OSHA, EPA and all other local, state and federal regulatory agency safety standards, as well as its own internal standards.

The management believes that cooperative emergency response with company employees, local emergency responders and regulatory agency people in will provide a safe workplace and a safe environment.  In an emergency, all personnel are instructed to cooperate with fellow employees and other support personnel as directed by the Emergency Response Incident Commander. 

KTR Phoenix LLC is a refrigerated warehousing facility. The large majority of products stored are refrigerated foods for human consumption and inherently pose no known environmental or safety risks.  Ammonia, a regulated substance, is the commonly used refrigerant in industrial grade refrigeration systems that maintain low storage temperatures and can be safely managed by trained operators. At this facility, two separate refrigeration systems are currently in use. 

KTR Phoenix LLC is committed to safe management and operation of the closed Ammonia Refrigeration System.  Maintenance employees are trained to observe operational procedures designed to be as fail-safe as possible to prevent accidental release

of ammonia at any time.  Should any accidental release occur, all maintenance employees are required to observe safe emergency response procedures.  They are trained to work in conjunction with the local Emergency Planning Commission to minimize the impact of any accidental releases.

As part of KTR Phoenix LLC's safety programs, we have adopted the OSHA Process Safety Management Plan as an integral part of our base safety manual.  The OSHA PSM Program has been implemented and covers the entire scope of safe operation procedures of the ammonia refrigeration system from start-up and normal operations to potential emergency response operations and subsequent clean-up and restoration of systems.  Normal operations rely on the following:

? The Maintenance Management Procedures are used to perform preventative
 maintenance and to maintain records of all maintenance work performed.  This
 helps to ensure that the closed ammonia system continues to work safely,
 reliably and efficiently in the originally intended manner.
 
? Any set specifications of systems temperature, pressure, level or power 
 interruption, that are exceeded or violated will normally trigger an alarm and
 safety shutdown.  Maintenance technicians are notified of a deviation from
 normal operational specifications through indicator or alarm systems.
 
? In the event of deviations, technicians are trained to analyze the situation,
 follow personal safety procedures at all times, determine that everything
 is under control and correct problems and/or deviations.
 
? If a problem cannot be corrected immediately, the equipment needing
 repair service will be safely locked out of service until such time as
 repairs have been completed.
 -3-
 
? If a problem cannot be safely handled by the Maintenance Personnel, procedures are in place to obtain the required resources to correct the situation.
 
 During the past five years there have been no accidental releases at this facility.
 
 
 EMERGENCY RESPONSE OPERA

TIONS READINESS INCLUDES THE THE FOLLOWNG PROGRAMS:
 
? Written procedures for emergency operations include emergency evacuation
 procedures, emergency shutdown instructions, emergency response unit coordination plans, regulatory agency
 notification and other pertinent information.
 


It is the intent of KTR Phoenix LLC to not only meet any regulatory requirement, `but also take a pro-active approach into implementing these requirements as part of a working safety plan.  KTR Phoenix LLC is in a constant review process of its operations and industry standards to provide a safe working environment for our employees, customers and neighbors.
